      • setGcalDescription

        public java.lang.String setGcalDescription(boolean completed,
                                  boolean deadline,
                                  boolean important,
                                  java.lang.String recurring,
                                  java.lang.String recurringId,
                                  java.lang.String labels)
        prevents loss of information. Attributes like 'important','deadline','recurring','labels' of the Task class do not exist in the class CalendarEventEntry of Google Calendar. Therefore the information is stored in the description of the CalendarEventEntry object.
        Parameters:
        completed -
        deadline -
        important -
        recurring -
        recurringId -
        labels -
        Returns:
        a string which is set to the description of CalendarEventEntry object.

      • importFromGcal

        public boolean importFromGcal()
        imports from Google Calendar. If an event of the same Id already exists, the entry is not imported. This is done to prevent duplication of Tasks in the live Storage
        Returns:
        try if importing is performed successfully

      • exportToGcal

        public boolean exportToGcal()
        Exports a task into the google calendar. If a task with the same id already exists, task is not exported to avoid duplication.
        Returns:
        true if exporting is done successfully.

      • sync

        public boolean sync()
        Firstly,deletes all the tasks which are not present in the software but are present in Google calendar. Then performs the import and export function.
        Returns:

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Returns:
        true if the user is logged in, otherwise false
